Class Interface

java.lang.Object
  Interface

public class Interface
extends java.lang.Object

The Interface class contains all the methods used to display the current situation in the game, such as the board, moves and scores; it also displays all the menus and executes the user's commands (the main menu can display rules as well).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mikolaj Gackowski

Constructor Summary
Interface()
          Constructor for objects of class Interface, but it contains nothing.
 
Method Summary
 int displayMidMenu()
          Displays a mid-game menu, designed to allow the user to either start a new turn or save inbetween turns
 int displayStartMenu()
          Displays a start menu, allowing the user to choose whether to create a new game, load an existing game, display the rules or quit.

          The main method which encompasses all of the program's functions.
 void manualCheckers()

Method Detail

displayMidMenu

public int displayMidMenu()
Displays a mid-game menu, designed to allow the user to either start a new turn or save inbetween turns

Parameters:
None -
Returns:
An integer from 1 to 4 (1 - Start turn, 2 - Save, 3 - Quit, 4 - Invalid)

displayStartMenu

public int displayStartMenu()
Displays a start menu, allowing the user to choose whether to create a new game, load an existing game, display the rules or quit.

Parameters:
None -
Returns:
An integer (1 - New game, 2 - Load game, 3 - Rules, any other - Invalid)

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method which encompasses all of the program's functions.

Parameters:
None -

manualCheckers

public void manualCheckers()
Used to test the board during early development and manually change array values; left in the code for maintenance.

Parameters:
None -

printBoard

public void printBoard()
Prints the board in response to the current checker positions stored in the field[] of Board.

Parameters:
None -

printChecker

public java.lang.String printChecker(int triangle,
                                     int vertical)
Determines the visual representation of a value in the array, such as a checker, empty space or decoration in two-dimensional space.

Parameters:
triangle - - The relevant index of the array
vertical - - Vertical position on board, measured as distance from the edges
Returns:
A three-character string representing what should be displayed on the board.

printDice

public void printDice(int[] dice)
Displays the values of dice which are still available as possible moves (that is, nto equal zero)

Parameters:
dice - - An integer array of four dice values

printScores

public void printScores()
Displays the scores of players, as well as an indication which one is the active player.

Parameters:
None -
